intro: Strigosella meyeri, commonly known as the Meyer's strigosella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this plant thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often found in rocky soils and alpine meadows, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution, Strigosella meyeri is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
